TopicTitle: Well my sister has her music on WAY to loud.

Articles.Content:
Me and my sister have to go into the computer room to use the computers.(Desktop PCs.)

And we are directly behind each other and I can hear her music through her headphones.

I\'ve already tried asking her, turning my headphones up louder than her and I even logged her off the computer when she went to get a drink.

I\'m also trying to slow the internet down on her...

Any ideas on how to get her to turn her music down?

The reason I don\'t want to hear her stupid music is because I\'m trying to successfully land on the moon and I cannot concentrate.

Also we have two totally different music tastes.(She likes techno where I like heavy metal.)

Me and my sister have to go into the computer room to use the computers.(Desktop PCs.)

And we are directly behind each other and I can hear her music through her headphones.

I\'ve already tried asking her, turning my headphones up louder than her and I even logged her off the computer when she went to get a drink.

I\'m also trying to slow the internet down on her...

Any ideas on how to get her to turn her music down?

The reason I don\'t want to hear her stupid music is because I\'m trying to successfully land on the moon and I cannot concentrate.

Also we have two totally different music tastes.(She likes techno where I like heavy metal.)

Take control of the computer and make it play heavy metal. Then, turn the volume way up so that it hurts her ears so much she HAS to stop.

Take control of the computer and make it play heavy metal. Then, turn the volume way up so that it hurts her ears so much she HAS to stop.

I can\'t.

My parents have a VERY good computer security thing.

Ask her to turn it up so you can hear it. And then bug her with a lot of questions about it.

She\'ll turn it down

log into 192.168.1.1 / 192.168.0.1 / 192.168.1.244 (admin / password or admin / admin is default most of the time)

If its on wireless - restrict access to her computer by MAC

if its wired Use QoS to reduce her computers priority to next to nothing

or

block access on her (local) IP or by MAC (depends on your router what you can do) to anything containing \'WWW\'

Or... You know... Ask her to turn it down

You stole my post!

What he said, get into the router and setup a firewall rule blocking her computer.

You stole my post!

What he said, get into the router and setup a firewall rule blocking her computer.

If I do that she will tell my parents and to them when I do this I\'m always the bad guy.

I have like 50 times.

Alright I\'m up for a challenge.

Downgrade Flash player on that computer?

You aren\'t thinking straight. DELETE flash player!
... tell her to turn it down. If she doesn\'t, go to your parents, if that doesn\'t work, then I can\'t help you. All I can say is to not provoke her by deleting stuff or limiting her bandwith.

This.

Download a virus onto her computer. Set her browser\'s homepage to some porn site. Go into device manager and disable her sound card. The possibilities are endless!
